content:
• Thursday, February 23, 2012
  • JOBS

    More on 51job (NASDAQ:JOBS): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue. Profit rose 22% Y/Y on increased...

    More on 51job (NASDAQ:JOBS): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue. Profit rose 22% Y/Y on increased sales from its online business and HR services, plus a jump in margins. The company also upped guidance for Q1, now expecting revenue of $59M - $62M and an EPS of $0.65 - $0.70 per ADS. Street consensus is for an EPS of $0.61 and revenue of $56M. Shares +7.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:48 PM
  • KND

    More on Kindred Healthcare (NYSE:KND): Q4 earnings miss across the board on greater than...

    More on Kindred Healthcare (NYSE:KND): Q4 earnings miss across the board on greater than expected Medicare cuts to its nursing center and rehab businesses. It also lowers guidance for FY12 below Street estimates, and says it's suspending giving quarterly guidance going forward because of the volatility from the changes. Shares -7.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 PM
  • MELI

    More on MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI): Q4 misses across the board despite a 36% jump in earnings as...

    More on MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI): Q4 misses across the board despite a 36% jump in earnings as the online marketplace reported higher revenue and more registered users. Shares -4.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:23 PM
  • WMGI

    More on Wright Medical Group (NASDAQ:WMGI): Q4 beats estimates but net income was lower Y/Y as...

    More on Wright Medical Group (NASDAQ:WMGI): Q4 beats estimates but net income was lower Y/Y as sales declined. The company also lowers its FY12 forecast, now expecting net sales of $472M - $489M and its EPS to be around $0.26 - $0.36. Analysts were expecting revenue of $490M and its EPS at $0.57. Shares -2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:10 PM
  • TIVO

    More on TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q4 beats estimates across the board, swinging to a profit off cost...

    More on TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q4 beats estimates across the board, swinging to a profit off cost reductions and settlement proceeds from its AT&T settlement. The company issued a downbeat forecast for the current quarter, however, now expecting a loss of $18M - $20M with service-and-technology revenue of $53M - $55M. Street estimates were for a loss of $13M on comparable revenue of $57M. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM
  • RBCN

    More on Rubicon Technology's Q4: The LED wafer maker partly blames its weak results on...

    More on Rubicon Technology's Q4: The LED wafer maker partly blames its weak results on concessions given to a top customer in exchange for a 2H12 contract. Like other LED industry players, Rubicon says excess supply-chain inventory is hurting demand. It expects Q1 revenue of $8M-$12M and EPS of -$0.10 to -$0.14, well below a consensus of $22.9M and $0.11. RBCN -14.4% AH. CREE -1.7%. LEDS -1%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM
  • RBCN

    More on Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN): Q4 profit dropped 94% as weak demand continues to hurt...

    More on Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN): Q4 profit dropped 94% as weak demand continues to hurt the company's sales. The company also projects a loss for the current-quarter, now expecting an EPS loss of $0.10 - $0.14 per share on revenue between $8M - $12M. The Street is at $23M in revenue and a profit of $0.11 per share. Shares -14.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM
  • CENX

    More on Century Aluminum (NASDAQ:CENX): Q4 misses EPS estimates on higher charge-offs and losses...

    More on Century Aluminum (NASDAQ:CENX): Q4 misses EPS estimates on higher charge-offs and losses stemming from derivatives hedging activities. The company also warns that market conditions remain volatile, and will continue to be sensitive to developments in the Eurozone and the Chinese economy. Shares -4.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM
  • INTU

    Up yesterday thanks to an earnings beat and guidance hike, Intuit (INTU -3.7%) reversed course...

    Up yesterday thanks to an earnings beat and guidance hike, Intuit (INTU -3.7%) reversed course in trading today, as investors took profits on a stock that was up 50% since August. Likely playing a role was Stifel's decision to initiate coverage with a Hold. Though liking Intuit itself, the firm believes there's no catalyst that can boost Intuit's growth to a level that would justify a higher valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM) is now up 11.6% AH following its FQ4 report (I, II); a bullish...

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM) is now up 11.6% AH following its FQ4 report (I, II); a bullish earnings call (webcast) appears to be helping. Among other things, Salesforce mentioned it won 100 7-figure deals during the quarter (up 4x Y/Y), and nine 8-figure deals, evidence that its efforts to secure enterprise-wide deployments are bearing fruit. Other cloud business software names could also be on the move tomorrow

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • WTI

    W&T Offshore (NYSE:WTI): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.27. Revenue of $262M (+40.1% Y/Y) beats...

    W&T Offshore (NYSE:WTI): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.27. Revenue of $262M (+40.1% Y/Y) beats by $24M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • WMGI

    Wright Medical Group (NASDAQ:WMGI): Q4 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $126.9M (-8.2%...

    Wright Medical Group (NASDAQ:WMGI): Q4 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $126.9M (-8.2% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN): Q4 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $19.4M (-34.2%...

    Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN): Q4 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $19.4M (-34.2% Y/Y) misses by $0.6M. Shares -14.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) +58.5% AH after the FDA's cardiovascular and renal drugs...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) +58.5% AH after the FDA's cardiovascular and renal drugs advisory committee votes 7-4 to recommend the approval of Chelsea's Northera drug. The FDA is set to make a final decision on Northera by March 28. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • OVTI

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ3 EPS of $0.13 in-line. Revenue of $185.2M (-15% Y/Y)...

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ3 EPS of $0.13 in-line. Revenue of $185.2M (-15% Y/Y) beats by $6.3M. Company expects FQ4 revenue of $195M-$215M and EPS of $0.15-$0.28, above a consensus of $170.7M and $0.10. Shares +14% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • DECK

    More on Deckers' Q4: Deckers is guiding for Q1 revenue growth of just 19% Y/Y, and an EPS...

    More on Deckers' Q4: Deckers is guiding for Q1 revenue growth of just 19% Y/Y, and an EPS decline of 50%. Current estimates are for 28.5% revenue growth, and 29% EPS growth. In addition, Deckers expects 2012 revenue growth of 15%, and EPS to be roughly flat with 2011 levels, with higher sheepskin costs pressuring earnings. The Street expects 19% revenue growth and 14% EPS growth. A $100M stock buyback has been authorized. DECK -10.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • KND

    Kindred Healthcare (NYSE:KND): Q4 EPS of $0.27 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $1.5B (+34.1% Y/Y)...

    Kindred Healthcare (NYSE:KND): Q4 EPS of $0.27 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $1.5B (+34.1% Y/Y) misses by $80M. Shares -8.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • XCO

    Exco Resources (NYSE:XCO): Q4 EPS of $0.09 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $178.8M (+71.4% Y/Y)...

    Exco Resources (NYSE:XCO): Q4 EPS of $0.09 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $178.8M (+71.4% Y/Y) misses by $47M. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Success in the deal to acquire 11 Sears (SHLD +18.7%) store locations for the buyer, General...

    Success in the deal to acquire 11 Sears (SHLD +18.7%) store locations for the buyer, General Growth Properties (GGP +2.8%), hinges on one property. Analysts say $250M of GGP’s $270M purchase went toward the store in Ala Moana Center in Honolulu; other anchor stores GGP has bought in the past year ranged from $2.5M-$30M, making Ala Moana a massive purchase.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 6 Comments
  • MNST

    More on Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Q4 beats on revenue but comes up shy on a per share...

    More on Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Q4 beats on revenue but comes up shy on a per share basis due to higher operating expenses and distribution costs. Gross sales for the quarter increased 28% Y/Y to $467M. Shares -5.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • SPN

    Superior Energy Services (NYSE:SPN): Q4 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $580M (+24.5%...

    Superior Energy Services (NYSE:SPN): Q4 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $580M (+24.5% Y/Y) beats by $14M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • MRVL

    More on Marvell Technologies (NASDAQ:MRVL): 4Q beats lowered estimates despite a 64% drop in...

    More on Marvell Technologies (NASDAQ:MRVL): 4Q beats lowered estimates despite a 64% drop in profit on weakness in the market for the chip maker's hard-drive components. Revenue dropped 18% Y/Y, extending a streak of lower earnings for the company over the past year, when broad economic uncertainty forced many electronics makers to cut back production. Shares +1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Worldwide (NASDAQ:MNST): Q4 EPS of $0.35 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $410M (+28.5% Y/Y)...

    Monster Worldwide (NASDAQ:MNST): Q4 EPS of $0.35 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $410M (+28.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -5.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • CRM

    More on Salesforce.com's FQ4: Though EPS guidance is light, the company expects FQ1 revenue of...

    More on Salesforce.com's FQ4: Though EPS guidance is light, the company expects FQ1 revenue of $673M-$678M and 2012 revenue of $2.92B-$2.95B, above estimates of $663.1M and $2.91B. Deferred revenue reached $1.38B, +48% Y/Y and soothing concerns about slowing growth. Unbilled deferred revenue +47% to $2.2B. Sales & marketing expenses +40% to $327.6M. Free cash flow was $195.7M, well above net income of $61.6M. CRM +8.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP): Q4 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $132.9M (+512% Y/Y) misses by $3M....

    Molycorp (MCP): Q4 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $132.9M (+512% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares +5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • DECK

    Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK): Q4 EPS of $3.18 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $603.9M (+40.4% Y/Y)...

    Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK): Q4 EPS of $3.18 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $603.9M (+40.4% Y/Y) beats by $38M. Shares -11% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • AIG

    AIG (NYSE:AIG): Q4 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.21. Net income of $19.8B includes deferred tax asset...

    AIG (NYSE:AIG): Q4 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.21. Net income of $19.8B includes deferred tax asset valuation allowance release of $17.7B for Q4, $16.6B for fiscal 2011. Shares +6.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • CROX

    More on Crocs' (NASDAQ:CROX) Q4: Retail sales +24% Y/Y to $74.1M; wholesale sales +6% to 104.1M;...

    More on Crocs' (NASDAQ:CROX) Q4: Retail sales +24% Y/Y to $74.1M; wholesale sales +6% to 104.1M; Internet sales +28% to $95.9M. Backlog +19% Y/Y to $307.4M. Sees 2012 revenue of $263M-$268M vs. consensus $268M and EPS of $0.24-$0.26 vs. consensus $0.30. Shares -12.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • WBMD

    WebMD Health (NASDAQ:WBMD): Q4 EPS of $0.31 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $150.7M (+-10.6% Y/Y)...

    WebMD Health (NASDAQ:WBMD): Q4 EPS of $0.31 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $150.7M (+-10.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM): FQ4 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $631.9M (+38% Y/Y) beats...

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM): FQ4 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $631.9M (+38% Y/Y) beats by $7.9M. Company expects FQ1 EPS of $0.33-$0.34, below $0.36 consensus. Expects FY13 EPS of $1.58-$1.62, largely below $1.62 consensus. Shares +5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 22 Comments
  • MELI

    MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI): Q4 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $86.5M (+38.8% Y/Y)...

    MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI): Q4 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $86.5M (+38.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -10.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • CROX

    Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $203M (+14% Y/Y) misses by $2M....

    Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $203M (+14% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares -5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • KBR

    KBR (KBR +9.3%) trades near its highs for the day despite posting Q4 results that missed Street...

    KBR (KBR +9.3%) trades near its highs for the day despite posting Q4 results that missed Street estimates due to lower sales. Net profit actually rose 15% amid a reduction in operating costs and its EPS for the quarter was better Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • KSS

    Kohl's (KSS -5.8%) shares keep sliding after the retail chain's disappointing Q4 and downward...

    Kohl's (KSS -5.8%) shares keep sliding after the retail chain's disappointing Q4 and downward guidance, but some analysts come to its defense. "Following a disappointing holiday season, KSS is focused on regaining price leadership in FY13 (Jan.)," S&P Capital IQ says, looking for "a stronger value message in pricing and marketing to drive growth in both traffic and units per transaction."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • AVGO

    Avago Technologies (AVGO +2.8%) gains after its FQ1 beat estimates earlier. Net profit rose 5%...

    Avago Technologies (AVGO +2.8%) gains after its FQ1 beat estimates earlier. Net profit rose 5% as the chip designer's wireless market drove stronger sales, but overall revenue growth slowed as contraction in its industrial market forces customers to cut back on orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • CXO

    Concho Resources(CXO -2.84%) dips after its Q4 loss widened on higher derivative-related losses....

    Concho Resources(CXO -2.84%) dips after its Q4 loss widened on higher derivative-related losses. Revenue growth however, was better-than-expected due to increased production and higher oil prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • LL

    Lumber Liquidators (LL +7%) shares rebound after an upgrade to Overweight from Neutral by Piper...

    Lumber Liquidators (LL +7%) shares rebound after an upgrade to Overweight from Neutral by Piper Jaffray with a higher price target despite disappointing Q4 earnings. The firm says it believes the hardwood flooring retailer pushed several one-time charges into the latest quarter to start 2012 with a clean slate; it also cites opportunities to expand margins meaningfully.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • BAM

    GrafTech (GTI -15.6%) shares skid as Q4 revenue growth fell short of expectations and its...

    GrafTech (GTI -15.6%) shares skid as Q4 revenue growth fell short of expectations and its full-year earnings view sharply misses consensus. The provider of graphite and carbon-based products and services expects lower sales volume of graphite electrodes this year due to the economic slowdown in Europe, where GTI has historically generated ~30% of its annual sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • AAXN

    Taser (TASR -7.4%) shares are zapped after disappointing Q4 results that included a charge to...

    Taser (TASR -7.4%) shares are zapped after disappointing Q4 results that included a charge to reflect the write-off of production tooling and excess inventory for its Taser X3 and the first generation of its Axon video system. Success of newer versions means TASR does not expect to sell existing levels of earlier generation products and accessories.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • CKP

    Shares of Checkpoint Systems (CKP -7.5%) take a hit after its Q4 loss per share was wider than...

    Shares of Checkpoint Systems (CKP -7.5%) take a hit after its Q4 loss per share was wider than Street estimates, and it projected FY12 results below what analysts were anticipating. It now expects an EPS of $0.55 - $0.76 on revenues of $845M - $875M. The Street is looking for an EPS of $0.96 on revenues of $928M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • MEET

    Quepasa (QPSA +2.2%) announces a new mobile currency that is says will help monetize its growing...

    Quepasa (QPSA +2.2%) announces a new mobile currency that is says will help monetize its growing mobile audience. Shares of QPSA - which were swimming around in negative territory for most of the day - shot straight up after the news was released.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +1.4%) gets a boost from positive comments out of JP Morgan earlier today,...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +1.4%) gets a boost from positive comments out of JP Morgan earlier today, saying the recent share weakness is overdone and represents a buying opportunity. The firm remains bullish on the stock and the growth potential of its hepatitus C treatment GS-7977.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • ESV

    Ensco (ESV +4.4%), owner of the world's second-largest offshore drilling fleet, reports...

    Ensco (ESV +4.4%), owner of the world's second-largest offshore drilling fleet, reports better-than-expected Q4 earnings and revenues, and expects deepwater revenue to double in 2012 due to the earnings from new rigs. Q1 revenue should rise 8% from the Q4 level of $1B-plus, with deepwater revenue growing 15%, though contract drilling costs should rise ~7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • PPC

    Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +3.3%) trades higher after Imperial Capital upped the shares to Outperform...

    Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +3.3%) trades higher after Imperial Capital upped the shares to Outperform earlier today and raised its price target for shares to $9 from $6 following the company's better than expected Q4 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLNE

    Shares of Clean Energy (CLNE +4.9%) spike higher after President Obama announces his intention...

    Shares of Clean Energy (CLNE +4.9%) spike higher after President Obama announces his intention to push forward natural-gas powered car development.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • JNPR

    Shares of Juniper Networks (JNPR -1.8%) lag after FBR Capital cut its rating to Market Perform,...

    Shares of Juniper Networks (JNPR -1.8%) lag after FBR Capital cut its rating to Market Perform, citing new product delays and performance issues which will impact revenue growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (CRM +2%) is trading higher ahead of this afternoon's FQ4 report - shares are now...

    Salesforce.com (CRM +2%) is trading higher ahead of this afternoon's FQ4 report - shares are now up over 30% YTD, and above where they traded prior to Salesforce's disappointing FQ3 report. Nonetheless, Nomura is reiterating a Buy today. The firm expects Salesforce to exceed revenue and billings guidance, and sees its product line expansion driving growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 1 Comment

  • Akorn (AKRN +7.5%) jumps on positive comments out of Deutsche earlier today, saying they're...

    Akorn (AKRN +7.5%) jumps on positive comments out of Deutsche earlier today, saying they're increasingly confident in the company's ability to meet or exceed 2012 guidance and achieve 30%-plus annual EPS growth over the next three years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • CYH

    Community Health (CYH +3.2%) moves up after Deutsche upped the shares to Buy earlier today,...

    Community Health (CYH +3.2%) moves up after Deutsche upped the shares to Buy earlier today, citing the improving U.S. economy and reduced legislative risk for the remainder of 2012. The firm also raises its price target to $33 from $22.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • TGT

    Deutsche Bank turns decidedly bullish on Target (TGT +2.9%), upgrading shares to Buy from Hold...

    Deutsche Bank turns decidedly bullish on Target (TGT +2.9%), upgrading shares to Buy from Hold and upping its price target to $64 from $48 on the back of its forecast for higher same-store sales at the retailer. Analysts with the firm even have an idea of where to come up with the cash to fund TGT purchases: sell WMT.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • DDS

    Shares of Dillard's (DDS +8.22%) roar higher after its Q4 results beat Street estimates earlier...

    Shares of Dillard's (DDS +8.22%) roar higher after its Q4 results beat Street estimates earlier today. Net earnings rose 29% Y/Y as the retailer logged another quarter of solid same-store sales growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR +5.9%) pops after its Q4 results easily beat estimates. Net earnings...

    Denbury Resources (DNR +5.9%) pops after its Q4 results easily beat estimates. Net earnings soared as higher oil prices contributed to the oil and natural-gas company's better-than-expected revenue growth and its 2010 takeover of Encore Acquisition made the company one of the country's largest independent oil producers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • ANGI

    Shares of Angie's List (ANGI +11.1%) run up a solid gain after the consumer review website...

    Shares of Angie's List (ANGI +11.1%) run up a solid gain after the consumer review website reports Q4 revenue of $27.4M, topping the $25.4M estimate by analysts. Traders are also fixating on the firm's lower costs for adding new subscribers, as the key metric fell 15% Y/Y to $51 a customer.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (SKUL -5.3%) heads lower in spite of beating Q4 estimates, as the headphone maker's...

    Skullcandy (SKUL -5.3%) heads lower in spite of beating Q4 estimates, as the headphone maker's in-line 2012 guidance (revenue of $275M-$295M and EPS of $1.10-$1.20 vs. consensus of $284.8M and $1.16) fails to impress. But D.A. Davidson is staying bullish, arguing Skullcandy will solidify its position as a top headphone brand this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • LVLT

    Level 3 (LVLT +10%) shares pop after Morgan Stanley raises its rating to Overweight from Equal...

    Level 3 (LVLT +10%) shares pop after Morgan Stanley raises its rating to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $31 price target. The firm sees accelerating revenue growth due to strong secular demand for connectivity, expanded capabilities due to LVLT's Global Crossing acquisition, strong margin expansion and controlled capital spending levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +2.8%) makes a new all-time high after receiving an upgrade to Buy...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +2.8%) makes a new all-time high after receiving an upgrade to Buy from UBS. The firm touts the "defensive growth" offered by Alexion's business model, the potential of its Soliris drug in treating multiple diseases, and improving visibility surrounding the rest of Alexion's pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • USO

    It's a wild day in the crude pits as oil moves higher overnight, crashes following bearish...

    It's a wild day in the crude pits as oil moves higher overnight, crashes following bearish inventory data, and then regains it all and more, WTI taking out $107 barrel for the first time since May. Gasoline prices are up 8.8% this year , but still below last year's May peak of $4.02/gallon and the July 2008 record of $4.16. USO +0.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • SHLDQ

    The twittersphere is abuzz about the rally in Sears (SHLD +19.7%) with sentiment from market...

    The twittersphere is abuzz about the rally in Sears (SHLD +19.7%) with sentiment from market watchers tipping toward seeing the action in shares as overdone. TheStreet.com's Glenn Hall doesn't mince words, tweeting that he would get out of SHLD on this pop with its "alleged turnaround" story past its sell-by date.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 6 Comments
  • AROC

    Shares of Exterran Holdings (EXH +17.8%) jump this morning after its parent, Exterran Partners...

    Shares of Exterran Holdings (EXH +17.8%) jump this morning after its parent, Exterran Partners (EXLP, +2.1%), agrees to buy its compression and processing assets for $184M in an effort to increase its natural-gas contract operations in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • FLR

    Fluor (FLR +4.64%) gains despite posting a mixed Q4 result, beating on a per share basis but...

    Fluor (FLR +4.64%) gains despite posting a mixed Q4 result, beating on a per share basis but coming up short on revenue. Net profit rose 31% however, on higher overall revenue and record margins from its mining unit, which was led by a jump in total bookings in its industrial and infrastructure segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
